newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Bank Melbourne shares still sliding.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Bank Melbourne shares still sliding.

text.p: Shares in Victorian-based regional bank Bank of Melbourne Ltd continued to slide in morning trade on Wednesday after Tuesday's soft profit result.

Bank of Melbourne shares slipped 1.7 percent to an intraday low of A$8.50, bringing losses in the last two days to 4.5 percent. On Tuesday, the bank announced a marginally lower first half net profit of A$40.1 million while holding its dividend steady.
"Bank of Melbourne is still a little bit softer," said a Brisbane-based dealer.
"The market still seems to be aborbing the result from yesterday. I thought it may have bounced but there is still a bit of selling around."
By 11.40 a.m. (0040 GMT), Bank of Melbourne shares were nine cents lower at A$8.56 on turnover of 615,458 shares.
